Posts.Signature: Age 70, ( now 73 ) consistent low psa till now, dre's are very important as this got way ahead of me without them! PSA rise 3.8 to 4.3 ( 10/2014 ) No family history, one of eleven siblings. Biopsy 11/20/14 Gleason 9 with 5+4, T2c score 9 or 10 of 12 positive 12/04/14 Cat scan, bone scan, m r i show confined to prostate gland Two weeks intensive research....HT and radiation decision made First HT 12/16/14 lots of side effects ( Degarelix ) (3/11 pain and bruising at injection site, sleep issues, sweats and maybe some dark thoughts) Second HT 1/13 no side effects ( Eligard )( much easier than the 30 day, no pain or bruising, only sweats and sleep issues ) Cat scan and tattoos 3/6/15 Dry run 3/18 actual radiation on 3/19 Wrapped up the radiation on 5/22 and met the Memorial Day goal! Second six month Eligard on 7/14/15. If follow up PSA test goes well may opt out. .01 PSA at 90 day follow up, opted out of h t after a year. Still undetectable after three years.
Posts.Title: Ray

Posts.Content: My P C treatment has begun with a 30 day hormone shot. Aside from the lumps and some manageable pain and eggs at the injection site, I am experiencing difficulty with B M's. I am taking softeners that do not seem to be helping much. My concern is that there is an upcoming marker procedure and straining is not good afterward. Wondering if I'm alone, or if not, what have others tried? I find myself relying on this site more and more. Thank you!

Posts.Title: do i have pc?

Posts.Content: Wrapped up 45 EBRT radiation sessions six weeks ago. For those of you considering radiation only option, added this to the " radiation log " elsewhere on this forum as an update. If you are new here, there is also a post on the radiation sticky that describes it all as best I could. There have been few complaints or problems, I'm also on H T and have those side effects too, again, not too bad. The waiting is tedious and probably the worst part of all of it. Still up 3 or 4 times a night and Flomax made little difference. Bm's which used to be consistent once a day in the AM are not so much anymore, aside from that, AOK, and I remain comfortable with my decision.

Posts.Title: Radiation Proctitis

Posts.Content: Never did I think I'd need such a site! One of eleven siblings in a healthy family with zero cancer aside from minor skin stuff. Recently had a biopsy after a rise from 3.8 to 4.3 in a years time. Referred to a Urologist who I really like and trust, he found cells in 10 of 12 zaps, both lobes, between 7 and 9 so pretty aggressive. Bone and cat scans show no spreading outside....thank you Lord. I'm pushing 70 and am leaning towards radiation though he will do the DiVinci if I insist. That is also the docs recommendation. My questions at this time are this; He wants to begin with hormone therapy. Good plan? What type of radiation would others here suggest? Regular or proton beam. I really want to go to Florida as usual! How long is it safe to wait from hormones to rad therapy? Lastly, have been getting blood work consistently but not the "one finger salute". That may have and probably would have found this much earlier. As much as we don't like it, find myself now wishing I had insisted on it. They tell me this is probably 3 to five years old. Thanks in advance, certain I'll be on here a lot while this progresses.

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by ASAdvocate They are called fiducial markers, and are used for different types of RT, such as IGRT and SBRT. They provide tracking points that the machine can use to compensate for body movements. Thanks, had not heard of it before and a quick search on here didn't show up any posts.

Posts.Title: Bone scan/MRI tomorrow - What's next?

Posts.Content: From everything I've read and studied, you can continue your normal life during radiation and most have few if any serious side effects. However, make your decision based on what the experts recommend and be sure to feel comfortable with and have trust in those you are seeing. I was told I was right at the tipping point as to surgery/radiation due to my age. You are considerably younger and if otherwise healthy should probably look at all options. Check in here often, you will find sincere helpful kindred folks.

Posts.Title: Long term side effects?

Posts.Content: Update on this; Urologist suggested a visit first to the gastro doc. He completed a colonoscopy nine months ago in November and after my visit today, his opinion is " radiation proctolisys " ( sp ). This is damage from the EBRT regimen completed fifteen months ago and it can be clearly seen. No huge surprise! Unrealistic to think there would be no effects. The flatulence and intestinal noises he believes are a separate issue connected to lactose intolerance. Going to try a life without dairy for two weeks to test.

Posts.Title: Long term side effects?

Posts.Content: Ever since the initial diagnosis I have been reading about long term side effects of RT and HT. It seems unrealistic to expect none after having forty five sessions of RT over a couple months, ending fourteen months ago. My next scheduled follow up and Urologist appointment is not til October but I'm noticing some changes recently and thought I'd throw them out here for possible comment as I've found this forum immensely helpful. Maybe someone on here has experienced something similar. First, the noise. There has been a marked increase in intestinal growling, I mean full on organ recitals that can be heard across a room by others. No discomfort. Second, gas. lately I can push a five or six second, two octave fart that would have made me a peep hero in grade school. Not so much now. Again, very little discomfort unless I'm forced to hold them so as not to embarrass my wife or me. Third, is some kind of sticky discharge. Best description I can provide is it seems like mucus. Very little fecal matter, pretty much clear. These are questions for the next Dr's visit, obviously, but wondering if there could be a more immediate need for attention. I feel good, and very relieved as to the outcome to date but want to stay on top of things. The side effects from the HT are mostly gone since the last shot was a year ago. Did not like them and so hope they are behind me for good. Thanks again in advance. This forum is the best!

At the same time, this could just be something basically harmless and not related to the treatments. Let's see what others have to say. In the meantime, good luck to you! Biopsy 11/20/14 Gleason 9 with 5+4, T2c score 9 or 10 of 12 positive 12/04/14 Cat scan, bone scan, m r i show confined to prostate gland Two weeks intensive research....HT and radiation decision made First HT 12/16/14 lots of side effects ( Degarelix ) (3/11 pain and bruising at injection site, sleep issues, sweats and maybe some dark thoughts) Second HT 1/13 no side effects ( Eligard )( much easier than the 30 day, no pain or bruising, only sweats and sleep issues ) Cat scan and tattoos 3/6/15 Dry run 3/18 actual radiation on 3/19 Wrapped up the radiation on 5/22 and met the Memorial Day goal! Second six month Eligard on 7/14/15. If follow up PSA test goes well may opt out. .01 PSA at 90 day follow up, opted out of h t after a year. Still undetectable after three years.
Posts.Title: Long term side effects?

Posts.Content: Update on this; Urologist suggested a visit first to the gastro doc. He completed a colonoscopy nine months ago in November and after my visit today, his opinion is " radiation proctolisys " ( sp ). This is damage from the EBRT regimen completed fifteen months ago and it can be clearly seen. No huge surprise! Unrealistic to think there would be no effects. The flatulence and intestinal noises he believes are a separate issue connected to lactose intolerance. Going to try a life without dairy for two weeks to test.

Posts.Title: Long term side effects?

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by HighlanderCFH Hi'ya rat, The symptoms you are describing do not seem to have any relation to prostate cancer, but I believe that radiation treatments can -- in rare cases -- have an effect on the bowels. At the same time, this could just be something basically harmless and not related to the treatments. Let's see what others have to say. In the meantime, good luck to you! Chuck Are you saying I'm getting old!!?? Actually, thanks as always, I'm watching it!

Posts.Title: Long term side effects?

Posts.Content: Got a call from a close friend of my brother ( brother is a full time beekeeper ) who was given a three year prognosis after trying everything. At my brothers suggestion, he tried bee venom and swears he is now a zero for two years. Even his doctors are baffled. Bee venom is injected by agitating the bee till he stings, I've heard it can also work with arthritis and other issues. Anyone offer more on this? I detest stings and they take a long time to dissipate, but bro Bob is being very insistent and thinks this should at least replace H T. I'm thinking.

Another reason is that I'm self employed and cannot afford the down time. I'm going with Lupron, IGRT and brachy boost. Thanks Tom Makes sense to me, check in often, bunch of caring folks here.

Posts.Content: You and your father have friends here, visit often, you will learn a lot and get answers to your queries. Your dad is a few years older than me and it sounds like it could be more advanced. He will most likely be given similar options to mine which are radiation as opposed to surgery. Primary right now is to have confidence in your medical group and research everything. We'll be here for you and yours.

Posts.Title: Prostate cancer low PSA

Posts.Content: I did not, and still do not like the hormone injections, however, I'm undetectable after a very aggressive gleeson 9 so not complaining! I would only suggest as others have, that you get all the info and be sure of your needs and course of treatment. I'm really not sure how many S T and L T side effects are a direct result but surmise most of them. E D is now a way of life.

Posts.Signature: Age 70, ( now 73 ) consistent low psa till now, dre's are very important as this got way ahead of me without them! PSA rise 3.8 to 4.3 ( 10/2014 ) No family history, one of eleven siblings. Biopsy 11/20/14 Gleason 9 with 5+4, T2c score 9 or 10 of 12 positive 12/04/14 Cat scan, bone scan, m r i show confined to prostate gland Two weeks intensive research....HT and radiation decision made First HT 12/16/14 lots of side effects ( Degarelix ) (3/11 pain and bruising at injection site, sleep issues, sweats and maybe some dark thoughts) Second HT 1/13 no side effects ( Eligard )( much easier than the 30 day, no pain or bruising, only sweats and sleep issues ) Cat scan and tattoos 3/6/15 Dry run 3/18 actual radiation on 3/19 Wrapped up the radiation on 5/22 and met the Memorial Day goal! Second six month Eligard on 7/14/15. If follow up PSA test goes well may opt out. .01 PSA at 90 day follow up, opted out of h t after a year. Still undetectable after three years.
Posts.Title: Surgery vs Radiation

Posts.Content: And the very same to you, Chuck and all. Was in the middle of telling a close friend about this site and particularly, you. He went through the robotic five years ago and wished he knew about this then. Extremely helpful! Thank you to all who post!
Posts.Title: Merry Christmas

Posts.Content: Morning; Love this site but wish I did not need to be here just like all of you. Had the first hormone injections 12/16, 30 day. Some soreness in the injection area but bearable, and a little irritability. Next is a six month dose set for 1/13, but prior to that I will have the markers implanted on 1/9. Similar procedure to a biopsy. They give the radiation techs a consistent target. The real protocol begins on 3/6 with a cat scan and dry run. Then 45 rad sessions, extra due to the agressiveness of my particular diagnosis. Gives us six weeks to get my head straight in Key Largo and treatments should be finished by Memorial Day. Can't say enough about the folks at Delaware Valley Urology, they make me feel like I'm the only patient they have. I should add that radiation is the only recommended course in my case due to age and other factors and every opinion agreed. I too, am confident and comfortable with the selected treatment. "As far as anyone knows, we only get one shot at this life, but if we do it right, one is enough". Wishing us all well! Regards, Dan H

Posts.Title: Did you get anesthesia during your biopsy?

Posts.Content: Initial dose was Degarilix, have the knots and soreness too. Stick and stones have been mostly uncooperative for a while now even before the hormones. Not sure what the 6 month stuff is, find out on the 13th. In my case the psa did not tell the story, should have been getting dre's too. Anyone reading this, take note. I'm now told this is advanced and aggressive. Two years ago my psa was 1.9! The very good news is that it appears to still be only in the prostate.

Posts.Title: Did you get anesthesia during your biopsy?

Posts.Content: I don't like the H T either, but, the effect of H T is that it kills testosterone that the P C cancer cells feed on. I specifically spoke to my oncologist on completion of R T and she strongly urged me to continue as testing has shown it to be effective. R T was my only course of treatment, salvage is different, so rules may be different.

Posts.Title: I just Want To Introduce Myself!

Posts.Content: One year ago I was a couple of months into HT and waiting to begin radiation. Noticed considerable hair loss then, and now, after a years worth plus of HT and 45 radiation sessions, still am lacking body hair pretty much all over, however, don't see any on the shower drain now. Seems obvious that the HT was the cause and wondering if this is just one more side effect.

Posts.Title: Hair loss, just wondering?

Posts.Content: I see references to "salvage radiation" often on here. I'm preparing to begin radiation oncology radiation early March. If my understanding is correct, salvage comes after surgery? Would that be to insure the margins are clear? Mainly just curious and feel one can not have too much input while facing P C.

Posts.Title: Bit of confusion

Posts.Content: Recent newbie here and get tons of input which I find incredibly helpful. My 45 year old son's life ended on 12/29 from a rare Gastro Intestinal Sarcoma Tumor. ( G I S T ) Unheard of at his age and information is hard to find, even on here. He was at the left end of the country ( Ca ) and good data was very hard to get. Guessing maybe I'm looking for some closure and wondering in which category I might find similar diagnosis's to look at. Seems life can be so unfair. Maybe a moderator could direct me or shift this to a better blog? Many thanks in advance.

Posts.Title: starting to feel the burn

Posts.Content: Welcome, Brahms.....sorta. I see hms already mentioned our running log efforts elsewhere on the site. At your age I probably would have opted for DiVinci. Have they indicated why it is inoperable, and have you considered a second opinion? I personally found this site incredibly helpful in many ways, recommend you visit often and feel free to ask any questions. You will only find the most helpful folks in similar situations. I'm done my 45 radiation sessions now and waiting for results. You may find that the waiting is the worst part, I did.

Posts.Title: Recently diagnosed with prostate cancer

Posts.Content: There is a ton of information on this PC site for you to read as you make your decisions. I found it immensely helpful and come here every day, offer input when I feel it could be of use. I'm nine months post RT and HT, had RT only, no surgery, but met many having salvage and shared much. I'll take the side effects and find them manageable, it's better than any option. Of course each individual is different and will react differently. I'm pretty sure the HT causes a lot of the side effects. In addition to the hot flashes, weight gain, and sleep issues, much of my body hair is gone, bowel movements are much changed and I'm still up at night anywhere from two to six times, and it's urgent. Sexual activity is a distant memory too and as of yet shows no sign of returning. On the other hand, I'm much older, and do have those memories. Read and study all you can, you will make it through this!

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by BigT today i am at 3 months post radiation treatment(39) for prostrate cancer. i was expecting to go back to normal within 2 to four weeks as i was assured by my cancer doctor. i never started feeling better at all. i experienced dizziness, shortness of breath, no energy, tiring too easy, and plenty of anxiety. i visited my urologist and primary doctor, who recommended i see my cardiologist where it was determined that i have an irregular heartbeat. Seems odd? Are they certain it is related somehow to the R T ?

Posts.Title: my husband diagnosed-even with thorough checking

Posts.Content: I don't know all the correct terms but am learning quickly. The way I now understand it after much research is that the proton beam is very precise, maybe too much so as it is good to hit what are called the "margins" surrounding the target area. I've opted for standard radiation ( 45 sessions ) in my case though proton is available across the river in Philly. Lots of factors entered into this. You will find a lot of help and input on this site. Very best to you.

Posts.Content: This site will help you a lot, Logic. It has me and I'm new. I'm pushing 70 and based on several opinions, have opted for radiation and hormone therapy. If I were 63, I would definitely do the robotic. Good luck to you and check in often!
Posts.Title: Must decide between surgery and radiation

Posts.Content: You have found a good place for support. You don't give your age or much detail, but I too was Gleason 9 though it did not spread. As you will see by my signature, similar treatment regimen and same side effects except for depression. Huge shock at initial diagnosis but thinking I've handled it well. Talk to anyone and read everything, it's your life, take charge. And come back here often, you are among friends and for certain not alone.
Posts.Signature: Age 70, ( now 73 ) consistent low psa till now, dre's are very important as this got way ahead of me without them! PSA rise 3.8 to 4.3 ( 10/2014 ) No family history, one of eleven siblings. Biopsy 11/20/14 Gleason 9 with 5+4, T2c score 9 or 10 of 12 positive 12/04/14 Cat scan, bone scan, m r i show confined to prostate gland Two weeks intensive research....HT and radiation decision made First HT 12/16/14 lots of side effects ( Degarelix ) (3/11 pain and bruising at injection site, sleep issues, sweats and maybe some dark thoughts) Second HT 1/13 no side effects ( Eligard )( much easier than the 30 day, no pain or bruising, only sweats and sleep issues ) Cat scan and tattoos 3/6/15 Dry run 3/18 actual radiation on 3/19 Wrapped up the radiation on 5/22 and met the Memorial Day goal! Second six month Eligard on 7/14/15. If follow up PSA test goes well may opt out. .01 PSA at 90 day follow up, opted out of h t after a year. Still undetectable after three years.

Posts.Title: Gleason score was 9 in April 2013. Had radiation and Lupron injections

Posts.Content: Quick search in these threads does not show much about hair loss. A year ago my wife called me her "woolly bear", that is no longer. Doubt I have a quarter of the hair I once had and even the pits and groin areas are sparse now. Doctors just shrug and mention side effects, but from what, I wonder? Is it the radiation or the H T ? Can't be the only one and am just curious.

Posts.Title: Who do you tell? and why tell them?

Posts.Content: I had three HT injections. 30 day and two of six month, last injection was on July of '14. Two and a half years later I am mainly back to normal as far as hair growth, hot flashes and such. Sex drive has not returned to any extent, that could be also connected with my age of almost 72. HT was worse than radiation in my mind. But, hey, the PSA is undetectable, that was the goal.

Posts.Title: hormone therapy side effects after 2 years

Posts.Content: At my age and in my situation, libido was the first victim. It left long before any P C diagnosis and I now feel the gradual loss of a sexual appetite was due to my "T" going to feed the as yet unknown P C. Soon after the first H T therapy, shrinkage came, only a shadow of what once was, and to add to the situation, now going through radiation therapy, you need to drop drawers in front of some very pretty young technicians, so maybe it is saving some embarrassment. On another hand, these techs promise to fix me up, and I do have my memories!

Posts.Title: How cancer effects me!

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Radio Active I'm not spamming... And, I don't have a problem sharing details either- I started having painful orgasm while I was getting ebrt, but still able to enjoy sex up to the point of climax. So I ended up learning how to build up the sensation right to the point of the pain starting, and the orgasm sensation kinda dies down, but I am learning how to just stay at the edge, and enjoy multiple orgasms... Not sure how long this will last, but me and the wife are really having fun Man I hope some of that activity comes back for me! Thanks for sharing. Think about adding a signiture so others here can compare?

Posts.Title: Amazing sex after radiation therapy... Am I the only one???

Posts.Content: Started 30 day hormone therapy 10 days ago, now know what pms must be like and have the tenderness and bruising. I've always been a dependable every morning, anyone else riding in this boat?

When you suspect something, there is a rush to find out everything you can quickly....trust me.....and trust this site, you will get loads of help here as you can already see. Also, I'm now a huge promoter of digital rectal exams as psa tests may not give the whole picture. In my specific case the blood work alone did not tell the tale.

Biopsy 11/20/14 Gleason 9 with 5+4, T2c score 9 or 10 of 12 positive 12/04/14 Cat scan, bone scan, m r i show confined to prostate gland Two weeks intensive research....HT and radiation decision made First HT 12/16/14 lots of side effects ( Degarelix ) (3/11 pain and bruising at injection site, sleep issues, sweats and maybe some dark thoughts) Second HT 1/13 no side effects ( Eligard )( much easier than the 30 day, no pain or bruising, only sweats and sleep issues ) Cat scan and tattoos 3/6/15 Dry run 3/18 actual radiation on 3/19 Wrapped up the radiation on 5/22 and met the Memorial Day goal! Second six month Eligard on 7/14/15. If follow up PSA test goes well may opt out. .01 PSA at 90 day follow up, opted out of h t after a year. Still undetectable after three years.

Posts.Title: Radiation ...how my experience was

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by hms03049 Thanks everyone for the good wishes and Jim's idea of a office gift at the end is a good one that I would have missed. The staff is very good to me. Today was #2 of 33, like MartyATX said "ground hog day" except much faster at 8 minutes in and out once my name was called. Wilde - with your numbers you have a good shot at not having to do this or a cure if you do. If I were you I would consider switching to the ultra-sensitive PSA test, just don't do anything rash until you really see a upward trend over several tests. As a G9 with positive everything I'm a poor canary in the coal mine to peg your sleep to, but then again they were surprised I made it a year at 0.1 without HT. I had hoped for the camaraderie among PCa soldiers Creekrat found at his sessions but it isn't happening. It is a large crowd but mostly women with only a few men. All but a couple look like they are fighting an end-game. God bless them. One big difference could be that all my fellow "raddies" are there for only P C treatment. All I've met range from early 60's to mid 80's. One is 87 and my new goal is to be as good as him at that age. I actually find myself going in early and hoping they are behind just to spend more time trading stories. My wife, God bless her, who goes with me to every appointment enjoys her time in "the outer" waiting room as well.

Posts.Title: Father with Gleason 9 & PSA 2.5

Posts.Content: Absolutely know where you are coming from! When you suspect something, there is a rush to find out everything you can quickly....trust me.....and trust this site, you will get loads of help here as you can already see. Also, I'm now a huge promoter of digital rectal exams as psa tests may not give the whole picture. In my specific case the blood work alone did not tell the tale.

Posts.Title: Hormone therapy underway

Posts.Content: Had the first of two Degarelix hormone therapy injections on Tuesday the 16th. Some pain in the belly area at the injection site but bearable. Four weeks till another of these, then short waiting time before starting radiation. This urological center has an on line patient portal where I can go for any information any time and it is very detailed. Maybe that is common? I am a 4+5 Gleason and a T2c score. Have decided to stay right where I started close to home. Everything I've read, studied, and heard makes me feel comfortable with this decision. Even the surgeon I spoke with thought radiation was the right course in my case. Maybe his cars are paid off? (joke)!

Posts.Title: Two years post initial diagnosis

Posts.Content: Two years since getting hit with the P C bat, one and a half since completion of R T, one year since last H T. Feeling fine, living life and still undetectable. Urologist does not need to see me for a year. Only observation is that the sex drive has not returned, keep wishing and hoping, wondering if some of the diminished drive is age related. So very fortunate to have a loving and understanding wife!

Posts.Title: Question

Posts.Content: As did my hero bobkeenan, I'm going to post weekly updates on my radiation experience. I'm facing 45 sessions starting Monday, March 16th and hoping all is behind me ( pun intended) by Memorial Day. Already had the cat scan tattoos and have a dry run Friday. Currently on HT, complete eunuch, night and day sweats and trouble sleeping. Otherwise no other complaints worth mentioning. I want to add that I'm very comfortable with Delaware Valley Urology. They make one feel you are the only patient they are treating. In my situation and with my prognosis, the only course suggested was this radiation regimen. I'm buckled up for the ride and hoping and praying for the best possible outcome. I am blessed with a super supportive wife and a huge family. That fact has already made it so much easier.

Second six month Eligard on 7/14/15. If follow up PSA test goes well may opt out. .01 PSA at 90 day follow up, opted out of h t after a year. Still undetectable after three years.

Posts.Title: Radiation log

Posts.Content: As did my hero bobkeenan, I'm going to post weekly updates on my radiation experience. I'm facing 45 sessions starting Monday, March 16th and hoping all is behind me ( pun intended) by Memorial Day. Already had the cat scan tattoos and have a dry run Friday. Currently on HT, complete eunuch, night and day sweats and trouble sleeping. Otherwise no other complaints worth mentioning. I want to add that I'm very comfortable with Delaware Valley Urology. They make one feel you are the only patient they are treating. In my situation and with my prognosis, the only course suggested was this radiation regimen. I'm buckled up for the ride and hoping and praying for the best possible outcome. I am blessed with a super supportive wife and a huge family. That fact has already made it so much easier.

Met a bunch of other P C patients today and now have a question. Every one of us had different lengths of treatment with mine being the longest at 45 and the lowest at 33. What parameters determine how many in each case? I won't see the doc till next Wednesday to ask him but it may give us another topic to discuss, as if we needed one.
Posts.Signature: Age 70, ( now 73 ) consistent low psa till now, dre's are very important as this got way ahead of me without them! PSA rise 3.8 to 4.3 ( 10/2014 ) No family history, one of eleven siblings. Biopsy 11/20/14 Gleason 9 with 5+4, T2c score 9 or 10 of 12 positive 12/04/14 Cat scan, bone scan, m r i show confined to prostate gland Two weeks intensive research....HT and radiation decision made First HT 12/16/14 lots of side effects ( Degarelix ) (3/11 pain and bruising at injection site, sleep issues, sweats and maybe some dark thoughts) Second HT 1/13 no side effects ( Eligard )( much easier than the 30 day, no pain or bruising, only sweats and sleep issues ) Cat scan and tattoos 3/6/15 Dry run 3/18 actual radiation on 3/19 Wrapped up the radiation on 5/22 and met the Memorial Day goal! Second six month Eligard on 7/14/15. If follow up PSA test goes well may opt out. .01 PSA at 90 day follow up, opted out of h t after a year. Still undetectable after three years.
Posts.Title: Radiation log

Posts.Title: Cialis and Heart

Posts.Content: Question concerning my brother who just had robotic surgery and is having a lot of trouble controlling his bladder. Those of you who had the procedure drop a quick note as to how long before control was recovered if you would be so kind. Well aware every situation is different. Surgery itself went well, recovery took longer than hoped but bladder remains the biggest issue after three and a half weeks. I have come to appreciate this forum and thank you all in advance!

Posts.Title: Bladder control after robotic surgery

Posts.Content: We all go through what you are experiencing right now, you are in a great place for support and information. I myself find the site immensely helpful and visit every day, often multible times. You need to have confidence and feel comfortable with those you trust with your treatments.There is a lot they can do and this is one of the most treatable of the cancers. As was told to me, he will most likely die with it and not from it. Come here often and keep us advised.
